bill.title: Office of Elections Package; Absentee Ballots; Electronic Transmission
bill.description: Allows a permanent absentee voter to temporarily receive a ballot at an alternate address for elections within an election cycle. Clarifies that certain conditions that normally lead to a termination of permanent absentee voter status do not apply if the voter resides in an absentee ballot only area. Replaces references to facsimile ballots with references to electronically transmitted ballots. Allows a voter to receive an absentee ballot by electronic transmission if the voter requires such a ballot within five days of an election, or the voter would otherwise not be able to return a properly issued ballot by the close of polls. (SD2)

history.action: Pending introduction.
Introduced and Pass First Reading.
Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 1
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Friday, 02-05-16 2:00PM in House conference room 325.

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 12 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, San Buenaventura, Belatti, Brower, Creagan, Hashem, Kawakami, C. Lee, Nakashima, Takayama, McDermott, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Morikawa, Woodson.

Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Har, Oshiro excused (2).

Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 869-16) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Third Reading.
Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday, 03-08-16.
